revised_title: Identification of Thyroid Hormones in the Endostyle of Ascidian Ciona intestinalis
tldr: The authors identified monoiodotyrosine, diiodotyrosine, and thyroxine in extracts of the endostyle of the ascidian Ciona intestinalis. Their findings suggest that the endostyle may be involved in thyroidal biosynthesis, although further investigation is needed to determine the exact process and its relationship to the thyroid gland.
